text: Val walks after a hastily retreating Kellogg.
I don’t know what happened. I’11 tear it down soon as we get home. Val pulls off his helmet, giving us a clear look at his f young, handsome, contained...but mad.

How about right now. Outside. Take your time. Rest of us’1l go on home, send someone back for you tomorrow. Jarrett walks up -- he’s ten years Val’s senior, cowboy-j steely-eyed. Calmer, wiser. Settled is more like it
You know, Jarrett, Val ought to show his tech man a little respect. Jarrett holds up the stolen dish component.

He just made us one point two. Sounds respectful to me. Val grins and lights a cigarette. Kellogg shakes his head disgruntled, turns and heads towards the bridge. Val star after him, but Jarrett lays a firm hand on his shoulder.
Next time I call abort and you feel like sticking around, I’m leaving without you. Val grins through his cigarette.
Promise?

Val straps into his seat, cigarette dangling from his mou Jarrett takes a seat across from him as Kellogg buckles i shotgun. ANDERS, the young pilot, takes the wheel. ANDERS. Trajectory’s locked. Translunar injection burn in ten ticks. Put that cigarette out, Val. (CONTINUED)
Val takes a big drag on his cigarette and holds the smok his lungs as he grinds the butt into the wall behind him. ANDERS (CONT’D) Five, four, three, two, one, burn.
The rocket ports on the back of the ship FLARE. The haule moves out.
As the G’s press him into his seat, Val exhales the cigar smoke in a long, steady stream. Jarrett shakes his head, trying not to smile. Val grins. hard feelings between these two.
The ship cuts a fast course for the moon.

An industrial complex sprawling three Chicagos big across lunar surface. Truck convoys stretch from the complex to horizon; a freeway’s worth of spaceship traffic constantl flies in and out. It’s always rush hour on the moon.
Hey, the kid’s back.
Mullins, my man.

Dark booths and hazy light. Dartboards. Workers come here when their shift is over. Val, Jarrett, Kellogg, Anders sit at a booth in the back, drinking and smoking. MULLINS, baby of the bunch, mop hea tousled hair, cocky smile, exchanges hand shakes and back slaps as slides into the booth.
How was Mars? Mullins shrugs like it wasn’t much. (CONTINUED)
Climbed the ice cliffs below Mount Olympus. Got laid. Twice.
That’s twice more than Jarrett in as many years. Mullins cracks a shit-eating grin. Val offers him a smoke
You ready to go back to work? Mullins takes the cigarette, gets serious.
What’s up? Val leans in, lowers his voice.
Dry dock gig. V-Class shuttle.
On the sly. Cool and by the numbers.
Mess with their heads, pick their pockets. Chop shop’s dark side.

You really expect Anders to land a V- Class on the dark side? ANDERS. I’d tell you how many times I’ve flown over Darkness if I thought you could count that high. Kellogg laughs at the ball-breaking. Val looks at Mullins
Want the job?
(grins) Got nothing else planned. Val lifts his glass in salute.
Here’s to crime that pays. (CONTINUED)
They all drink up.

The moon’s commuter train. Packed with workers and white collars in a collective day’s-end trance. Val stands a bit drunk among the others as the tram speed along. He stares up through a SKYLIGHT, dreaming alone. HIS POV: Millions of STARS shine sharp and bright in the lunar sky.
Jarrett’s voice over the black.

(filtered) Val. Wake up. INT. VAL’S APARTMENT - LCC Views of the Fra Mauro highlands out the window. Pictures sailboats on the walls, a sextant on a shelf. An empty pressure suit hangs on the door like a ghost.
(filtered) Answer me, Val. Val bolts upright in bed at the sound of Jarrett’s voice. Touches a sensor that produces a small HOLOGRAPHIC JARRET
Yeah.
South Agridome in twenty minutes. Entrance nine.
What’s goin’ on?
Tycho Brae wants to meet. (CONTINUED)
(surprised) Both of us?
That’s what he said. Twenty minutes. Jarrett’s holograph disappears. Val gets up.
Two thousand acres of farmland under a translucent dome.

Val and Jarrett stand in the middle of an enormous field crops growing in synthetic soil. A solitary, artificial r cloud moves low over the field, watering it a row at a ti Two men approach from across the field. The taller one is TYCHO BRAE, interplanetary boss. Close Jarrett’s age, but more refined and sophisticated. A man complete control of everything and everyone around him.
Jarrett. Val. Brae motions to the other man -- NIGEL, slightly younger, look of pronounced indifference on his face.
Val, this is Nigel. Nigel takes care of business for me when I’m unable to...much the same as Jarrett used to do before our situations changed--
What do you want, Brae? Brae pauses, like he’s refraining from lobbing an insult.
I want to offer you a job.
You know the deal. we get five hundred to put the suits on, extra five if it’s dry-dock work--
This job pays twenty. Million. (CONTINUED)
Jarrett’s stunned. Val doesn’t miss a beat.
What is it? Brae directs his attention to Val.
Freighter payload.
Class?
Light Speed. This stops Val for a beat. Jarrett squints.
Is it in dry dock?
No.
It’s in a surface hangar?
Huh-uh. Jarrett looks stumped but Val gets it right away.
(cool) You want us to hit it in-flight. Brae gleams.
Yes.
You’re kidding...
Off Mars Coast, while it’s in-bound, at sub-light velocity, of course.
No he’s not... (CONTINUED)
Fifteen million credits, plus another five in mining options if you deliver the payload completely intact.
What’s the payload? A beat. Then a smug grin winds across Brae’s face.
The ship’s the payload, isn’t it? Brae nods at Val, impressed.
This is one sharp apprentice you’ve got, Jarrett.
You’re out of your mind.
I know. I can’t help it. The whole idea makes me crazy.
Hijack a Light Speed Freighter?!
Hijack and steal.
That’s never been done.
The entire history of mankind is one continuous refutation of that statement. You should know better... at your age. Jarrett doesn’t react.
Forgive me for the ass-kissing, but you’re the best crew for the job. The launch window opens in sixty days, the offer’s good for forty...but I’d prefer not to cut it so close.
You already have our answer. (CONTINUED)
Brae shakes his head.
Come on, Jarrett. Take a smoke break. Life’s too short.
Gets a lot shorter if you drop the ball in zero-g. Brae smiles at Jarrett.
Always loved how you dare to dream... (glances at Val) Forty days, twenty million. Roll those numbers around and call me. Brae turns and leaves. Nigel follows.
Val and Jarrett have the tram to themselves.
We should do this.
Last time I did a big job with Brae I spent the next three years of my life in the Arctic Prison.
That was ten years ago...you’ve pulled jobs for him since.
Five hundred grand is a job; fifteen million is a whole different thing.
Twenty.
We’re not doing this, Val.
But we could do this. 12. Jarrett looks at Val, dead serious, cutting him off. (CONTINUED)
Things are good for us right now. We have it down. I’m not pissing it away on some rodeo ride for Brae. The tram stops.
It’s cold in the Arctic Prison. Jarrett steps off. The tram starts. Val watches him disappear as the tram SPEEDS AWAY.

Dim lighting. Hints of movement, something open and sexua going on in the shadows. Val enters and heads for the bar. A bald man with a head of tats, face pierced like a pin-cushion, and a boa constrictor draped over one shoulder puts a drink in fron him. One or two other creepy characters nod to val. It’s obvious he’s a regular. Val lights a cigarette, takes a swig of his drink ADRIENNE, 20s, beautiful, cold as metal, lips like black petals, takes a seat next to him. She runs a hand through hair, gives him a kiss.
Ready, baby? Val downs his drink. They both get up. INT. ADRIENNE’S ROOM - CESTUS CLUB Val lies back on a large, round cushion, drifting in the sleepy early stages of a blissful intoxication.
Last job took us close, closest I’ve been in a while. Adrienne comes over to him, leans down...
Look up. (CONTINUED)
...and squeezes a dropper into one of his eyes. She flood his eyeball with a clear liquid, then does the same to th other. Val blinks. Adrienne moves away.

The whole thing was right beneath me. I could pick out the Indian Ocean. I could taste the spray. Tasted like my childhood... Adrienne reappears and hands Val a small vial of neon blu liquid. He dabs it onto his tongue and hands it back VAL (CONT’D) I’m going back someday, Adrienne.
You’re going back right now.

For real. The lights go down. Val looks around. It’s a look of peac VAL (CONT’D) I’m going to sail the ocean. We hear the SOUNDS of the ocean. VAL’S POV: The boundaries of the room have given way to TROPICAL SKIES and swelling OCEAN WAVES, as if Val was ri on a boat through high seas. Adrienne reappears. She is naked, skin shining through a sheen of body oil. She walks to Val over the “water,” lay down next to him, starts to undress him. CLOSE ON VAL’S FACE as he enjoys his hallucination.
I’m gonna sail the Earth. As Adrienne slowly climbs on top of him, the room looks b and empty as before. Only Val can see the ocean.
MAGNIFIED POV: EARTH - the South Pacific Ocean to be prec  15.

People, mostly parents and children, sit around the room comfortable VIEWING STATIONS, looking at their selected telescopic images on thin computer monitors. Val sits alone, staring at his ocean, when a HAND touches arm. He looks up to see Nigel standing above him.
What do you want?
To talk.
Go ahead.
Not me. Val suddenly swoons under a wave of nausea. VAL’S POV: Nigel becomes fuzzy, almost glazed over. He ho up his hand to reveal a small PATCH on his finger. He has drugged Val.
Let’s take a ride. Val falls into an immediate physical torpor. He’s powerle to resist. He talks like someone shot full of Novocaine.
You son-of-a-bitch.
VAL’S POV: A BLUR of light...Nigel’s face looking down at out of the blur. A sign reading ‘TRANQUILITY BASE MUSEUM--BLUE LINE’ whizz past Nigel’s shoulder. We’re on the tram.
A long moment passes in the blackness. Then a voice...
Bring him up. (CONTINUED)
VAL’S POV: A soft SPOT of light...sharpening to clarity. Nigel and Tycho Brae looking at us.
Sorry about this, Val. But I just can’t be seen in certain public places on short notice. Pending legal issues...

The site of man’s first moon landing has been made into a museum. It’s all there: the LM, a stiff aluminum American flag, Neil and Buzz’s footprints scattered in the dust. One giant leap preserved under a glass dome. Val sits in a front row seat, waking up out of the drug. and Nigel stand in front of him. Val gets his bearings, s up and PUNCHES Nigel in the face. Nigel barely flinches. Grabs his nose and stares blankly Val as blood runs over his fingers.
Go wipe yourself. Nigel leaves. Brae offers Val a cigarette.
Smoke? Val ignores him.
Your monkey said you wanted to talk Brae puts the cigarettes away.
You’ve been working with Jarrett for a while now, haven’t you?
Since right after he finished doing time for you. Brae laughs.
Is that how he tells it? what, that I left him hanging in the wind? That I even set him up, maybe? (CONTINUED)
Something like that.
But never that he just choked on the first real opportunity that came his way? Val doesn’t respond.
Tell me something, Val. How many real opportunities has Jarrett handed you? Val bites his tongue.
He saved my life.
That’s a start.
Taught me everything I know.
And I, him. Val doesn’t continue. Brae lets the silence hang.
You could take the freighter, couldn’t you?
I don’t work alone-- Brae interrupts, pushing the question.
But one could take the Light Speed Freighter? I mean, you do agree with me that it could be done? Val’s quiet for a second. Then...
With the right crew, anything’s possible. Brae nods his head. (CONTINUED)
That’s what I like about you, Val. You’re a man of vision. Just like me. You see in...possibilities. Val stares hard at Brae.
Quitting Jarrett to work for you isn’t one of them. Jarrett’s family. I don’t walk away from that. Brae ponders Val for a second, then speaks softly.
Our entire universe is expanding as we speak. A continuous, never-ending explosion. You and I are pieces of stars, Val. Infinity is now. He pauses one last time, then smiles.

Only a fool tries to go again it. INT. VAL’S APARTMENT Val sits still, lost in thought, staring out the window. VAL’S POV: The EARTH hangs high above the lunar landscape half a blue marble in the deep black sky.

Mullins steps off the tram and walks with the other passe towards the station exit. Ahead, however, there’s a bottleneck. Mullins and the oth slow down. Something’s going on... Two COPS, dressed in Kevlar suits, their faces hidden beh mirrored riot shields, are escorting a manacled prisoner. It’s ANDERS, the pilot...Busted! A plainclothes DETECTIVE trails behind. As they make thei way through the onlookers... Mullins and Anders lock eyes for an instant. Anders, pale as a dead man, looks scared. (CONTINUED)

He’s whisked across the platform into a special TRAM CAR. cops pile in behind him and the car disappears down the t with a WHOOSH. Mullins double-times it out of the station INT. JARRETT’S PLACE - LCC The perennial bachelor’s pad. A digital projection of a F Hals 16th Century Dutch military portrait floats on the w Val, Jarrett and Mullins are present. The mood is grave. A TONE sounds in the room.
Yeah? KELLOGG’S FACE appears in the middle of the portrait.
(filtered; on monitor) It’s me. Kellogg’s face disappears from the portrait. The door sli open and he enters the room.
No good. They took him off-moon two hours ago. Be at least a week before his arraignment. Val turns to Jarrett.
Then we decide right now. Silence.
Where are we gonna get another pilot this quick?
Gifford can hook us up. It’1ll cost us--
We’ll take it off the pilot’s end. Everyone looks at Jarrett
I need this job, man. (CONTINUED)
Jarrett remains stone-faced through a long, heavy silence Then he turns to Val.
Call Gifford and set it up. Jarrett looks at the others.
I need this job, too.

A steam-filled labyrinth of ducts and pipes. A loud HISSI over everything. Val and Jarrett stand together, waiting. A FIGURE EMERGES from the steam. A man in a black coat. A he gets closer, we see that his chin and lips are one big recent scar, like someone tried to pry open his mouth wit shovel. This is GIFFORD, interstellar scum-bag.
Nice to see you boys slumming again.
(referring to the scars) Didn’t have to get all prettied up just for us.
Goddamn Stumper tried to give me a rhinoplasty. Fuckin’ things are swarming my nightmares --
Where’s our pilot? Gifford’s miffed at Jarrett for interrupting.
Making sure you’re not cops. He waves to someone behind him and smiles. GIFFORD (CONT’D) You guys are gonna like Lester. Another figure emerges from the steam. This one is a woman. (CONTINUED)

LESTER RILEY. Tall, young and beautiful. Strong and lithe Deep, piercing eyes. Sex snared in body armor. GIFFORD (CONT’D) Lester, meet the boys. The men are surprised. They obviously weren’t expecting a woman, much less a gorgeous one.
(to Gifford) “Lester?” Lester nails Val with a hard stare.
What’s wrong? Never saw a pilot wearing pants you wanted into? Val’s caught out by the attitude...but likes it.
Think I was just expecting someone...shorter.
I heard you Earth-system guys were small time, but I thought that was about balls, not brains. Gifford snorts a snot-drenched laugh.
Nothing small here, sister. We’re running a big toy to the dark side.
If it’s got a stick, I can handle it. Val laughs.
Let me guess, not a cockpit you can’t fit?
Something like that.
Well, if you fly as good as you talk we might have to take you on. She walks right up to him, looks him straight in the eye. (CONTINUED)
Are you Jarrett? Val grins, cocky, holds out his hand.
I’m Val. She doesn’t take it.
Then I’m wasting my time. Val frowns at the put-down. Jarrett steps forward.
I’m Jarrett. Lester turns to him, extends her hand.
Lester Riley. I thought this was a done deal.
Word is you last worked outer system, pulled a big job off Triton Coast with the Gates brothers.
I flew for Billy for six months.
Why’d you leave?
It was a...language thing.
What’s that?

Well, see, Billy speaks English fine, but he doesn’t understand it too well. I used the word “No” several times one night and maybe it’s just me, or maybe it’s all that reefer Billy smokes, but I had to stab him through the hand so he could hear better. That dissolved our partnership. Jarrett nods, grins. (CONTINUED)
Language thing.
Poor Billy.
Interview over?
Still want the job?

Long as you understand that while we’re in-flight and I’m at the stick my word goes until engine shutdown. I call the shots while we’re pulling G’s. End of discussion. Val burns. But Jarrett doesn’t flinch.

No problem there. Long as you understand that if you so much as fantasize about calling shots after engine shutdown, I will put a bullet through your skull without feeling bad. Far as discussion’s concerned I’1l go ahead and shoot you now if you object. Lester gives Jarrett a million dollar grin.
You got yourself a wheel man. Jarrett smiles back. He can’t take his eyes off of her. V notices and doesn’t like it.
Then how about we cut short this love- in and go steal ourselves a spaceship.
A repair garage floating in space. Long cylindrical tubes connect two enormous docking rings rotating like giant Ferris wheels at each end. Stuck to the rings are a VARIETY OF SPACECRAFT.  24.

The SOUND of rushing air. Then a BUZZER. Inner doors open and the next shift of mechanics and engi pours from the airlock. Among them...MULLINS AND KELLOGG, dressed as maintenance Mullins carries a case. They exit and head to the right. Then, VAL, JARRETT AND LESTER, also dressed maintenance, carrying large duffle bags. They head left.
Val, Jarrett and Lester blend in with the heavy foot traf They walk fast, without a word. Another corridor breaks off to the right. Val takes it al

Mullins stands watch. Kellogg, wearing dark glasses, punc buttons on a keypad next to the door. CLOSER ON KELLOGG’S GLASSES, as a series of tiny numbers scroll across the inside of his lenses. It’s a micro-HUD, feeding him the entry code. A light flashes on the keypad. Mullins clamps a pair of d glasses over his face and nods at Kellogg. They OPEN the door and step quickly inside--
The door SHUTS. A surprised TECHNICIAN swivels around in seat and starts to get up.
Hey, what?-- Mullins SWINGS his case into the Technician’s head. He go out cold and Kellogg takes his seat at the console. Mulli tears open his case and pulls out a polymer MACHINE GUN.
Shipping containers stacked to the ceiling. (CONTINUED)
Val hunches beneath them and unzips his duffel bag. Inside is his PRESSURE SUIT.

Jarrett and Lester open up their duffels. Jarrett pulls o his pressure suit, then stops, watching Lester stripping of her maintenance suit to her underwear, all-business. She looks right at him as she peels off her clothes. Jarr follows suit.
The Technician lies unconscious on the floor, wrists and ankles cuffed. Kellogg and Mullins wear com headsets.
(into headset) Everybody on?
Val, fully pressurized in his suit, speaks.
One.
Jarrett responds as Lester stands by.
Two and three.
Kellogg watches codes roll over a monitor in front of him One line stops moving and starts blinking.
Okay. Got it. Serial number Vv, S, nine, seven. Port docking ring, slip twelve. That’s ours.
Jarrett, again.
Fuel status?  26.
Val listens.
(filtered) Hypergolics, seventy-five percent. Battery, twenty. Cryogenic, zero.
Lester nods to Jarrett.
Bring the house down.
Val tenses up. He grabs the rungs of a ladder bolted into wall behind him and looks ahead at the cargo bay door.
(filtered) You set one? CLOSE ON VAL’S FACE as he breathes in deep.
Fuckin’ golden.
Kellogg dangles his finger over a button...
And out of order came...chaos. ...then presses it. A light begins to FLASH on the monito He touches another and a short ALARM sounds once.

The cargo bay door BLASTS OPEN. Containers are SUCKED out a rush of escaping atmosphere. Val CLINGS to the ladder, his legs extending straight out watches the last container spiral out of the hold, then h LETS GO and TUMBLES the length of the room--
(CONTINUED)
--where he glides behind the ejected containers for just second, before he FIRES HIS BOOT THRUSTERS and zips down length of the space station.
A thousand ALARMS go off. A startled CONTROLLER spills hi coffee as he checks his console.
I’m showing pressure failure in number two cargo bay! His SUPERVISOR springs into action.
Get me visual! The entire bank of monitors GOES DEAD.
Kellogg wreaks havoc with his keyboard.
Blindfold’s on, now we spin ‘em...
Red lights start to FLASH. More ALARMS scream.
Fire! Starboard docking tunnel! A- section!
Seal and flash it! Sound the alarm! An ARMED GUARD bolts from the room.

Emergency alarms WAIL. Workers SCRAMBLE for safety. FIREMEN and GUARDS rally. Bulkhead doors SEAL. INT. “A-SECTION” CORRIDORS - SEQUENCE A dense, burst of DRY CHEMICALS engulfs the corridors, extinguishing a non-existent fire.
Kellogg monitors the chaos. (CONTINUED)
You there yet, one?
Val coasts over the port docking ring. A V-CLASS PASSENGER SHUTTLE is parked up ahead in Slip 12 Its silver fuselage glints like a bullet in the sun. Val lands firmly beneath the cockpit windows.

On the property. He makes his way “Spidey-like” on hands and feet across t surface of the shuttle to the hatch where he kneels “upsi down” and uses a tool to jimmy the handle. The ROTATION of the docking ring brings a small EARTH swi momentarily into view behind him. Val opens the hatch and slides into--
It’s dark in here. A LIGHT on Val’s helmet comes on. He pushes off and floats to a small console.
I’m inside. Give me the numbers.
Kellogg takes a cue from his monitor.
Three, seven, five...
Val keys the sequence into the console.
(filtered) ...nine, zero, six. The cockpit starts to blink awake.
She’s alive.  29.
Jarrett and Lester are ready to go.
Two and three coming in. Lester opens the door slightly, but closes it quickly as phalanx of GUARDS hurries past. When the coast clears, Le and Jarrett step out into--
Emergency lights flashing, alarms still SOUNDING. Jarrett walks straight across to a door marked: Construct Access Lock: Authorized Personnel Only.
Open it. The inner door slides OPEN. Jarrett and Lester step insid
The inner door CLOSES. Jarrett hooks a tether to Lester. They look at each other for a moment, then tuck their hea
Blow it. The outer door OPENS. Jarrett and Lester are SWEPT into space.
Jarrett and Lester come out of their tumble in the middle the port docking ring. Jarrett FIRES his thrusters and to Lester to the shuttle.
Jarrett and Lester climb in.
We're in. Val pulls the hatch SHUT. He LOCKS it. Lester STRAPS hers into the pilot’s seat. She checks the controls. (CONTINUED)
Guidance is up. Tracker’s disabled. Engines are primed. We’re ready to disconnect. Val and Jarrett strap in behind her. Val glances at Jarre
You bring that bullet? Lester shoots him a look. He smiles at her.
Kellogg feeds more commands into the console.
Disconnecting...now.
Hoses and pipes BLAST from the fuselage and the shuttle b to DRIFT gently out of the slip.
Val watches Lester.
Stand by for my favorite part... Lester reaches up and grabs two handles.
Full thrust. She pulls the handles.
The engine ports at the back silently EXPLODE. The shuttl ROCKETS away.
Lester, Val and Jarrett smash against their seat backs.
Kellogg and Mullins, minus his gun and case, exit the aux control room. Kellogg touches the keypad and nods to Mull They pull off their glasses and walk away from each other  31.
The monitors come back on. The controllers look stunned.
What the hell--?
(eyeing his monitor) Fire’s out. Pressure restored--
(checking all his systems) Hold on here...We’re missing a ship. We’re missing a whole goddamn ship!
The massive station becomes a shiny dot in the shuttle’s It’s a clean getaway.
Lester watches a clock countdown the burn time. She shove the handles back into place.
Thrust out.
Nice job.
We’re not on the ground yet.
Punch out anytime, Mister--
The ship rifles towards the moon.

The moon swells outside the cockpit windows. On the horizon, the line of debarkation from light to DAR SIDE of the moon approaches fast. A heads-up COMPUTER IMAGE of the mountainous lunar landsc comes up on the cockpit window. It shows the ragged moon rushing beneath them at a fantastic rate. (CONTINUED)
Val looks ahead, anxious.
Welcome to the dark side of the moon.
The shuttle disappears into the inky night of the dark si
Lester watches the heads-up imaging on the cockpit window Beyond that...only the deepest black.
Firing descent engines.
FLAME leaps from the descent engine nozzles.
Lester concentrates on the heads-up image. Val does his b to annoy her.
Seatbacks and tray tables to their upright positions, please. It’s a balmy 200 degrees on the moon. We hope you’ve enjoyed your flight-- Suddenly an ALARM sounds and the heads-up imaging DISAPPE
Eyes are gone. She tries a series of switches.
Backup’s not responding!
Must be a fail-safe.
The chop shop’1l shoot us down if we can’t light up at their beacon.
I’m going manual. (CONTINUED)
Lester releases the steering console. It pivots up in fro of her and she grabs the stick.
Call it off! Pull out!
No! Jarrett looks at Val like he can’t believe what he just h
We can make it.
Somebody call out the vectors! Val swivels his seat away from Jarrett to the nav console
Altitude twenty, velocity ninety- seven hundred --
The spacecraft HURTLES down through the darkness. Jets of FIRE spit from the descent engines.
Val, again.
Ten down, one-thousand forward...
We can still ditch it.
Not unless I say so.
The descent engines burn hotter as the shuttle plunges to shadows of a JAGGED LANDSCAPE.
Lester, Val, Jarrett strain to see through the blackness.
I got visual. Fifteen degrees. (CONTINUED)
Val and Jarrett glance forward. Like a single bulb in an ocean of black-- A TINY RED LIGHT appears below and ahead.
Hit the lights. A swath of LIGHT shoots out from the shuttle, barely pier the blackness to reveal-- A MOUNTAINOUS CRATER RIM about to kiss the window.
Hang on! Lester swings the stick
A blast of THRUST and the shuttle VEERS left, missing the mountain top by inches.
Val and Jarrett brace themselves as the shuttle HEAVES.
Lester--
Let me fly this bitch, goddamnit!
The ship SWERVES, CRACKS THROUGH LOOSE ROCKS on a hilltop WEAVING through a rugged CANYON as it descends towards th light at the bottom of a GIANT CRATER.
Val and Jarrett hang on as Lester ROLLS the shuttle sidew
It sneaks through a narrow passage into the crater.
Lester brings the ship level and smooth. (CONTINUED)
Plenty of room.
The ship SLOWS even more. A series of thin LIGHTS erupt from the red beacon on the surface below and paint a CROSSHAIRS over a landing site.
A “Fuel Warning” FLASHES.
You’re on fumes. Lester ignores it.
Don’t even need ‘em...contact.
The shuttle TOUCHES down. The red beacon goes off.
Lester kills switches.
Shutdown. Throws off her belts, turns in her seat to face Jarrett.
Wanna shoot me, boss? She looks pissed as hell. But Jarrett just stares back at her, poker-faced, until he cracks a big smile.
Yeah, I think I do. Lester grins. So does val.

The lunar surface behind the shuttle OPENS UP, revealing RAMP leading down. Three large LUNAR TRUCKS roll up, hook the shuttle and start to tow it underground.  36. INT. “CHOP SHOP” HANGAR - BENEATH THE MOON Two dozen MEN with heavy tools descend upon the shuttle. rappel down from the ceiling, others move in on the groun They are stripping parts from the spacecraft as Val, Jarr and Lester emerge from the hatch, tired. VINCENT, an overweight man in dirty coveralls, approaches

All I got is scotch. INT. VINCENT’S OFFICE - CHOP SHOP A dog-eared sofa, some folding chairs and a steel desk. Val, Jarrett, Lester and Vincent drink Johnnie Walker Bla and smoke cigarettes. Thick windows look out on the rapidly disintegrating shut Vincent scrutinizes Lester.
Triton, huh?
Yeah. Triton.
It’s a moon, Vincent. Orbits Neptune.
I hear something about a new prison out there, on Triton. Lester looks him straight in the eye.
I try to stay away from prisons. Vincent sits back in his chair
I don’t travel deep sky much, myself. (sips his scotch) Too easy to get lost.
Got a feeling Lester knows her way around. (CONTINUED)
Lester smiles at him. Jarrett smiles back.
I’d take that tour.
